channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Dungannon: Woman arrested over death of two-year-old girl
item.description: The police are also given an extra 36 hours to hold a man arrested on suspicion of murder.

item.title: Dungannon: Petrol bombs thrown during disorder
item.description: Officers say up to 30 people wearing balaclavas blocked a road and set fire to furniture on Saturday.

item.title: Belfast flooding: Clean-up in Ardoyne after weekend flooding
item.description: Several centimetres of raw sewage built up at the back of one home as drains struggled to cope.

item.title: Ballymurphy march marks 50th anniversary of Army shootings
item.description: Organisers say they oppose proposed legislation to end Troubles-era prosecutions.

item.title: Covid-19: One more Covid-linked death and 1,129 new cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,220.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ireland's Kellie Harrington wins Olympic boxing gold with victory in lightweight final
item.description: Irish boxer Kellie Harrington wins an Olympic gold medal after defeating Brazil's Beatriz Ferreira in the women's lightweight final.

item.title: 'I didn't watch it - I stayed in the garden'
item.description: Kellie Harrington's family in Dublin enjoy seeing the 31-year-old become only the third Irish boxer to win an Olympic gold medal.

item.title: The highs and lows for NI's Olympians in Tokyo
item.description: We take a look back on the performances of 31 local competitors representing Team Ireland or Team GB at the Olympic Games.

item.title: Portaferry tree felling plans to be reviewed by council
item.description: There is a proposal to cut down 14 mature trees for more parking spaces in the County Down town.

item.title: Floods cause disruption amid NI weather warning
item.description: Northern Ireland remains under a yellow weather warning for thunderstorms after rain brought flooding.

item.title: Irish language: 'We need to ensure the Gaeltacht survives'
item.description: There are fears Covid-19 could seriously damage traditional summer Irish language courses.

item.title: Covid-19: NI has the highest infection rate in the UK
item.description: Hospitalisations and deaths increase, but the data shows the vaccine is doing its job.

item.title: Q&A: What are Northern Ireland's Covid travel rules?
item.description: With guidance on travel changing regularly, BBC News NI's Jayne McCormack explains the latest rules.

item.title: All 16 and 17-year-olds in NI to be offered Covid jab
item.description: There are also changes to NI's travel list, with fully-vaccinated arrivals from France no longer required to quarantine.

item.title: Covid-19: Are NI's young people resisting the vaccine?
item.description: Why do vaccination numbers among the under-30s in Northern Ireland remain relatively low?

item.title: Covid-19: Hospital visiting rules tightened by NI health trusts
item.description: Officials have halted or restricted visitors' contact with patients as pressure mounts on services.

item.title: Q&A: Getting jabbed after NI vaccination centres close for first jabs
item.description: Saturday is the last day to get your first dose of a Covid jab at NI's mass vaccination centres.

item.title: Anorexia: Planning for a wedding with an eating disorder
item.description: Leah Brown says she was "bombarded" with online weight-loss ideas when planning her big day.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NBA prospect Aidan Igiehon blazing an Irish trail in US basketball
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Lilian Bland: The Carnmoney engineer who took to the skies
item.description: Exhibition focuses on Lilian Bland who became the first woman to build and fly her own plane.

item.title: Weather: Anglers' relief as rain returns
item.description: The record temperatures of July led to river levels dropping seriously low.

item.title: The Northern Ireland teacher on a mission to make learning more fun
item.description: Conor Bradley first started posting his lessons online to help kids learn over lockdown.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Jordan Leckey: Jam sandwich tops off possible record-breaking swim
item.description: Jordan Leckey is waiting to hear if he's officially set a new record for a swim from NI to Scotland.

item.title: Adoption in NI: Families welcome new laws to provide support
item.description: Adoptive parents welcome a new bill to modernise NI's laws and provide families with more support.

item.title: North coast murals spring up 'to encourage footfall'
item.description: The mayor of Causeway Coast and Glens says the new installations are "a fantastic talking point".

item.title: Londonderry man is jailed after refusing hotel quarantine
item.description: Court hears man did not quarantine after returning from Turkey because he could not afford the cost.

item.title: Derry City: Lafferty double and McGonigle strike give Candystripes 3-0 win over Drogheda United
item.description: A double from Daniel Lafferty and Jamie McGonigle's first goal for the club give Derry City a convincing 3-0 win over Drogheda United.

item.title: A5 road project exceeds £80m with work yet to start
item.description: The dual carriageway will connect Londonderry to the border at Aughnacloy and beyond to Dublin.

item.title: Rosslare Port: Heroin worth more than €12m seized
item.description: Revenue says investigations are ongoing following the seizure of the drugs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ireland allows up to 200 to gather at outdoor events
item.description: Customers will also be able to book multiple tables in outdoor hospitality venues.

item.title: Teenage girl killed in County Meath crash
item.description: The 17-year-old died at the scene of the crash in Drumree on Thursday, while two men were injured.

item.title: Cork: How sheep and goats uncovered hidden headstones
item.description: More than 500 graves thought lost forever have been uncovered by volunteers - both animal and human.

item.title: Ireland's most expensive ram sells for 44,000 euros
item.description: The ram's County Donegal owner says the record-breaking price is a "once in a lifetime" deal.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish 12-15-year-olds can register for jab from next week
item.description: The plan to extend the country's vaccination programme was announced in July.
